extendedIngredients.name: eggplant
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium eggplant (3/4 pound), peeled and sliced about 1/3" thick

extendedIngredients.name: flat leaf parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves

extendedIngredients.name: garlic clove
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium garlic clove, peeled and sliced

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon minced peperoncini or red pepper flakes

recipes.title: Grilled Marinated Eggplant
recipes.instructions: Preparation                                                        Finely chop the parsley with the capers and garlic. Add the oregano and peperoncini and chop everything together. Put the mixture in a bowl, stir in the oil, season with salt and pepper, and reserve.                                                                 Preheat an outdoor charcoal or gas grill or a grill pan until smoking hot.                                                                Put enough eggplant slices on the grill to cover it without crowding. Cook the eggplant until well marked, 3 to 6 minutes, then turn the slices over. Cook until tender, about 3 minutes more. Remove the eggplant from the grill.                                                                 Pour the vinegar into a shallow bowl. While still hot, dip each eggplant slice into the vinegar and set it aside on a plate. Continue grilling and dipping the eggplant until all the slices are cooked and seasoned.                                                                Spoon 2 tablespoons of the parsley mixture onto a platter and spread it evenly with the back of a spoon. Arrange half of the grilled eggplant on the parsley in a single layer. Smear each slice of eggplant with more parsley. Place a second layer of eggplant on top and spread the remaining parsley on it. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and set aside to marinate at room temperature for about 2 hours (or refrigerate for longer). Serve at room temperature.                                                            Chef's notes:                You could make the parsley mixture in a food processor, but I don't. I find hand chopping gives me the somewhat drier texture I prefer.                                                                For this recipe, I don't salt or oil the eggplant; I grill it dry. This way, it has a nice chewy texture. I marinate the eggplant as soon as it comes off the grill so the flavor of the marinade penetrates.                                                                            Reprinted with permission from Salt to Taste: The Keys to Confident, Delicious Cooking by Marco Canora  with Catherine Young, Â© 2009 Rodale Inc.

steps.step: Finely chop the parsley with the capers and garlic.
Add the oregano and peperoncini and chop everything together.
Put the mixture in a bowl, stir in the oil, season with salt and pepper, and reserve.
Preheat an outdoor charcoal or gas grill or a grill pan until smoking hot.
Put enough eggplant slices on the grill to cover it without crowding. Cook the eggplant until well marked, 3 to 6 minutes, then turn the slices over. Cook until tender, about 3 minutes more.
Remove the eggplant from the grill.

Pour the vinegar into a shallow bowl. While still hot, dip each eggplant slice into the vinegar and set it aside on a plate. Continue grilling and dipping the eggplant until all the slices are cooked and seasoned.

Spoon 2 tablespoons of the parsley mixture onto a platter and spread it evenly with the back of a spoon. Arrange half of the grilled eggplant on the parsley in a single layer. Smear each slice of eggplant with more parsley.

Place a second layer of eggplant on top and spread the remaining parsley on it. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and set aside to marinate at room temperature for about 2 hours (or refrigerate for longer).
You could make the parsley mixture in a food processor, but I don't. I find hand chopping gives me the somewhat drier texture I prefer.

For this recipe, I don't salt or oil the eggplant; I grill it dry. This way, it has a nice chewy texture. I marinate the eggplant as soon as it comes off the grill so the flavor of the marinade penetrates.
Reprinted with permission from Salt to Taste: The Keys to Confident, Delicious Cooking by Marco Canora  with Catherine Young, Â© 2009 Rodale Inc.
